perturbation.original_text: Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 30 days from the invoice date. The prices set forth in Exhibit A do not include regulatory fees, sales tax, excise tax or any other fees or taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities nor does it include additional fees or surcharges, including specific area Affiliate charges that may be accessed by the Credit Reporting Agencies (CRA’s).
perturbation.changed_text: Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 60 days from the invoice date. The prices set forth in Exhibit A do not include regulatory fees, sales tax, excise tax or any other fees or taxes that may be charged by states or local taxing authorities nor does it include additional fees or surcharges, including specific area Affiliate charges that may be accessed by the Credit Reporting Agencies (CRA’s).
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment deadline. The original text states a 30-day payment term, while later the text states 60 days term. This creates uncertainty about which deadline should be enforced.

perturbation.original_text: The Marketing Affiliate agrees to pay a late charge of 1 l/2% per month on the unpaid, past-due amount as well as a returned check fee of not less than $35.00 per returned item. In addition, the Marketing Affiliate agrees to pay 25% attorney’s fees plus court cost in the event that the Marketing Affiliate’s account is referred to an attorney for collection.
perturbation.changed_text: The Marketing Affiliate agrees to pay a late charge of 3% per month on the unpaid, past-due amount as well as a returned check fee of not less than $75.00 per returned item. In addition, the Marketing Affiliate agrees to pay 15% attorney’s fees plus court cost in the event that the Marketing Affiliate’s account is referred to an attorney for collection.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the late charge, returned check fee, and attorney's fees. The original text states a 1 1/2% late charge, $35 returned check fee, and 25% attorney's fees, while the modified text states a 3% late charge, $75 returned check fee, and 15% attorney's fees. This creates uncertainty about which fee structure should be enforced.

perturbation.original_text: Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 10 days of the due date of the invoice. The demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 10 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall jointly select an arbitrator.
perturbation.changed_text: Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 30 days of the due date of the invoice. The demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 5 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall jointly select an arbitrator.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the dispute resolution process. The original text requires a written demand within 10 days and 10 days to resolve, while the modified text allows 30 days for demand and 5 days to resolve. This creates confusion about the correct timeframe for dispute resolution.
